refnamediv.refpurpose: computes an approximation of the 2-norm condition number of a s.p.d. sparse matrix

refsynopsisdiv.title: Syntax
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: [K2, lm, vm, lM, vM] = cond2sp(A, C_ptr [, rtol, itermax, verb])

listitem.para: a real symmetric positive definite sparse matrix
a pointer to a Cholesky factorization (got with taucs_chfact)
(optional) maximum number of iterations in the underlying algorithms (default 30)
(optional) boolean, must be %t for displaying the intermediary results, and %f (default) if you do not want.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This quick and dirty function computes (lM,vM) using the iterative power method and (lm,vm) with the inverse iterative power method, then K2 = lM/lm. For each method the iterations are stopped until the following condition is met :

but 4 iterations are nevertheless required and also the iterations are stopped if itermax is reached (and a warning message is issued). As the matrix is symmetric this is the rayleigh quotient which gives the estimated eigenvalue at each step (lambda = v'*A*v). You may called this function with named parameter, for instance if you want to see the intermediary result without setting yourself the rtol and itermax parameters you may called this function with the syntax :
refsection.programlisting: [K2, lm, vm, lM, vM] = cond2sp(A , C_ptr, verb=%t )

refsection.title: Caution
refsection.para: Currently there is no verification for the input parameters !

refsection.title: Remark
refsection.para: This function is intended to get an approximation of the 2-norm condition number (K2) and with the methods used, the precision on the obtained eigenvectors (vM and vm) are generally not very good.
